author: M Soundariya Preetha
text:
The IT and ITES sector in the State has sought exemption from mandatory holiday on the day of Tamil Nadu Assembly elections (May 16) only based on similar exemption provided in a couple of other States (Maharashtra and Telangana). The industry will benefit if there is a uniform norm across the country, said K. Purushothaman, senior director – Tamil Nadu and Kerala of NASSCOM.

Reacting to the Chief Electoral Officer’s statement that such a request was against the law, and therefore could not be allowed, Mr. Purushothaman said that over 40 per cent of the employees in the IT and ITES companies in Tamil Nadu are from other States and they would not benefit from the holiday.

Further, critical works could not be stopped at the IT and ITES companies. The industry is ready to grant permission to those who want to cast their vote and then come to work or grant holiday to those who want to go to their hometown, he said.

‘Industry will benefit if there is a uniform norm across the country’
title: Exemption from holiday provided in other States: NASSCOM
